newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee weaker on dollar, stable on pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee weaker on dollar, stable on pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee was fixed slightly weaker against the dollar and stable against the pound on Friday, foreign exchange dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at a mean commercial rate of 20.1365 against the dollar from 20.1315 on Thursday. Against sterling, the rupee was unchanged at the mean rate of 32.8765.
Dealers said despite a weaker dollar in overnight international markets, the rupee was slightly weaker because of a central bank intervention on Thursday afternoon.

"The Bank of Mauritius selling rate of dollars was higher than the prevailing interbank rate during the intervention. This effect offset the international depreciation of the dollar," one dealer said.
The dealer added commercial banks were running short of forex reserves because of importers' demand exceeding hard currency supply from the island's export sectors.
